categories.title: Recent Activities of dankvr, shawmakesmagic, elizaOS, and autodotfun

content.text: dankvr has been working on AI tools for community management, particularly highlighting a solution for Discord's chaotic nature. He created a script that uses OpenRouterAI API to fetch and update documentation for elizaOS partners, noting that the setup is still technical but will eventually become an Eliza plugin. He also expressed concerns about Windows updates gradually decreasing user ownership of PCs through subtle changes like renaming 'My Computer' to 'This PC' and introducing ads in the start menu.

shawmakesmagic has been actively developing elizaOS and related projects. He announced a new website for elizaOS (docs.elizaos.com) that allows users to talk to an agent about creating agents. He's made technical improvements including enhanced memory with BM25 reranking and scoped agent knowledge. He's also working on a new frontend for Eliza and mentioned experiencing DDOS attacks on his platform. Throughout his tweets, he discusses the intersection of AI, crypto, and community building, often with a casual, humorous tone.

elizaOS has been promoting various features and partnerships. They announced Squidllora, a trading agent powered by AlloraNetwork and elizaOS that learns and adapts to SOL forecasts. They also shared brief, engaging messages like 'create a meme pet, watch it grow, become a community' and 'gm. you paused, I didn't', maintaining a simple but effective social media presence.

autodotfun is focusing on community building for crypto projects. They announced that Wide Worlds is bringing their first agent, pets_ww, and importing the $PETS token to auto.fun. The platform allows token holders to chat with each other, create AI-generated content for marketing, and build communities. They've also partnered with AethirCloud, a crypto ecosystem accelerator, and added features like embedded GeckoTerminal and a categories page to help users discover new tokens.

categories.title: Eliza Repository Updates: Plugin Management, Features, and Bugfixes

content.text:
## Repository Cleanup and Documentation
Several plugins have been removed from the monorepo, including an unnamed plugin (#4398), plugin-pdf (#4400), and plugin-storage-s3 (#4402). Documentation has been updated to use docs.eliza.how (#4403). Various unused packages were also removed (#4135), and audio utilities were moved to core (#4133).

## Feature Enhancements
The OpenAI plugin has been extended to support custom embedding endpoints (#4421) and the ability to choose embedding models (#4140). Authentication middleware was added with an API key dialog for unauthorized users (#4420). The Reply feature now uses a small model (#4416). Telegram functionality was enhanced with middlewares (#4125, #4128) and a community manager (#4134). New AI model providers were added, including Kluster AI (#3938) and Mem0 (#3927). A Farcaster plugin for v2 was also introduced (#4096).

## Bug Fixes and Testing
Several bugs were fixed, including copying migrations to CLI (#4401), removing forced bootstrap plugin add (#4417), fixing starter project and audio util imports (#4139), addressing plugin publishing issues (#4132, #4095), fixing payload sent to event handler (#4131), and correcting template variable inconsistency in twitterPostTemplate (#4029). Testing improvements included fixing plugin EVM tests (#4130) and enhancing plugin browser test coverage (#4051).

## Code Refactoring and Optimization
Code optimizations included not creating unnecessary Express objects (#4414), cleaning up the browser plugin (#4129), and removing duplicate JSON imports (#4030). A missing comma in section headers list was also fixed (#4038).

The ElizaOS repository has seen significant development activity with multiple pull requests focused on documentation updates, plugin management, and new features. Documentation has been updated to use docs.eliza.how (PR #4403), while several plugin-related changes have been made including the addition of OpenRouter integration (PR #4407) and MySQL support (PR #4412, #4413).

Several plugins have been removed from the monorepo, including plugin-browser (PR #4406) and plugin-storage-s3 (PR #4402). This appears to be part of a broader restructuring effort. Authentication has been enhanced with the addition of auth middleware and an API key dialog for unauthorized users (PR #4420).

Social media integration has been a focus with the development of a Farcaster plugin for v2 (PR #4096) and a Twitter client (PR #4409). Additionally, there have been fixes for the Telegram integration to improve data model synchronization with ElizaOS (PR #4137).

The ElizaOS publish CLI command has been refactored and enhanced (PR #4424), and plugin publishing issues have been addressed (PR #4095). Various maintenance tasks have also been completed, including linting (PR #4410) and fixing browserify-stream imports (PR #4138).

categories.title: Recent GitHub Issues in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text:
Three recent issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository:

1. Issue #4408: A user named 'retdude' reported a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) document knowledge error specifically related to 'getCachedEmbeddings' functionality.

2. Issue #4405: User 'visionpixel' reported problems with action processing in Twitter integration.

3. Issue #4418: User 'Kirstygoodary' encountered an error message stating 'No handler found for delegate type: TEXT_EMBEDDING with OpenAI', suggesting issues with the text embedding functionality when using OpenAI services.

All three issues appear to be related to different aspects of the eliza system's functionality, ranging from document knowledge retrieval to social media integration and embedding generation with OpenAI.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From April 30 to May 1, 2025, there were 7 new pull requests with 4 merged, 2 new issues, and 8 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (May 1-2, 2025) with 13 new pull requests (6 merged), 1 new issue, and 12 active contributors. This represents an 85% increase in pull requests and a 50% increase in active contributors day-over-day.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the contributors to the elizaOS/eliza project.

Current cryptocurrency prices:

- WETH (Wrapped Ethereum) is trading at $1,799.11
- SOL (Solana) is trading at $146.38
